content: hey guys welcome to Dan's craft as you know I'm DM Scotty good to have you with

I also have a angle here so this is nice for making straight 90-degree got a

didn't have they have smaller one of these they're more like a ruler with it

a more professional one but you wouldn't have to get something this fancy you

I would recommend getting something like that and this was pretty cheap just a

I'll just one nice trick is to cut a flap off of the edge of a box the end of

I rarely ever use this in my craft occasionally I might use it but rarely

I've had a lot of questions about brushes and here's a pack of brushes

a little interest so those are great for that and like I say if you need more
this only comes with one but if you wanted more of these you could buy these

you'll be set ok guys now I'm going to talk about glue guns these are a very
integral part of the dams craft makes the crafting quick and easy and very
durable and cheap now you can see I have two different size glue guns and I
talked a lot about the different sizes in my videos although I tend to call
this one a small glue gun it's actually called a mini glue gun so if you're
trying to buy this glue gun the smaller size you want to get a mini glue gun not
not a small this is just a standard size if it says glue gun you're probably
gonna get this size so basically the the difference between the two sizes when I
work on tiles and larger objects I'm using the bigger one because I can get
more glue out at once and quicker and the small one is for more detail if I'm
trying to build the small objects or if they're worse and I don't want to get
glue all over the place I'll use a smaller one now I also have some glue
sticks here and these are the longer glue sticks they do have shorter glue
sticks that are half this size but I would really recommend using the longer
ones because when the glue stick runs out you have to put another you have to
put another glue stick in the chamber and it pushes the old glue stick forward
and it a bit for the new glue stick to get
caught in the mechanism so it's it's not always a great transition between the
two glue sticks so the less you have to change it the better your crafting will
be and the less headache it'll be if you're in the middle but if you're
middle of putting a wall down and you run out of glue and you got to try to
get it done then a glue stick in there and get it on there before the other
glue dries so you know I really recommend these longer the longer sticks
so that's really in about the glue guns and like I say or these have less of me
a long time I've had these forever I probably spent about 15 bucks between
the two of them these aren't special they're just plug in standard glue glue
guns you can get the cordless but my problem with that is it may run the the
energy or the charge may run out while you're trying to craft something or
something like that or they'll just plug it in and be sure that it's going to
work every time so there you go there's glue guns and now I move on to the next
tool so besides the glue gun these are really only two other adhesives I use I
use this Elmer's glue-all which is just a craft glue you could use any other
kind of white craft glue there's all kinds of craft glue and you can use any
one of those but I just use this it's cheap it gets the job done
and in the various videos you see me use it for I'll blow on certain details that
are really so small that they're hard to put on with the glue gun
or I'll be adding rubble or flocking to a base or to some piece of terrain this
stuff works great with that now I also have this goop I discovered
this stuff I used to use the to mix epoxy but that's messy and you got to
mix it and it's you know it's it's just a pain in the butt but this stuff is
very similar to epoxy but it has that kind of strength but it's just right out
of the tube you just squirt it right out of the tube it's this stuff is way
better than super glue super glue is messy and the gel you get the teeny
teeny bit in the thing this has a whole tube of the other glue it's very strong
works great a good simulation or a good replacement for the epoxy which is just

that aren't cardboard that I've made out of some other material maybe like a cast

general for general use you're gonna use the glue gun and the crap white craft
glue so you really don't have to worry about this this is good to have for
